Authors:
Diego L. Salariato, Liliana M. Giussani, Osvaldo Morrone,
Fernando O. Zuloaga
Title:
Rupichloa, a new genus segregated from Urochloa (Poaceae)
based on morphological and molecular data.
Abstract:
Rupichloa, a new genus of Paniceae, restricted to Bahia
and Minas Gerais, Brazil, and including two species: R. acuminata and R.
decidua are here described. Phylogenetic analyses of DNA sequence data
from plastid rpl16 and ndhF, indicate that both species do not belong to
Urochloa, genus in which they were previously placed. Also,
morphological characters are analyzed in relation with Urochloa. Hence,
Rupichloa was established on the basis of morphological and molecular
characters. Additionally, affinities of the new genus with other genera
of the Paniceae are also discussed.
